comment:
* A class that can be used to compute the CRC-32 of a data stream. * *

Passing a {@code null} argument to a method in this class will cause * a {@link NullPointerException} to be thrown.

* * @author David Connelly * @since 1.1

methods.name: public void update(int b)
methods.comment:
* Updates the CRC-32 checksum with the specified byte (the low
     * eight bits of the argument b).

methods.name: public void update(byte[] b, int off, int len)
methods.comment:
* Updates the CRC-32 checksum with the specified array of bytes.
     *
     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
     *         if {@code off} is negative, or {@code len} is negative, or
     *         {@code off+len} is negative or greater than the length of
     *         the array {@code b}.

methods.name: public void update(byte[] b)
methods.comment:
* Updates the CRC-32 checksum with the specified array of bytes.
     *
     * @param b the array of bytes to update the checksum with

methods.name: public void update(ByteBuffer buffer)
methods.comment:
* Updates the CRC-32 checksum with the bytes from the specified buffer.
     *
     * The checksum is updated with the remaining bytes in the buffer, starting
     * at the buffer's position. Upon return, the buffer's position will be
     * updated to its limit; its limit will not have been changed.
     *
     * @since 1.8

methods.name: private static native int update(int crc, int b)
private static int updateBytes(int crc, byte[] b, int off, int len)
private static native int updateBytes0(int crc, byte[] b, int off, int len)
private static void updateBytesCheck(byte[] b, int off, int len)
private static int updateByteBuffer(int alder, long addr, int off, int len)
private static native int updateByteBuffer0(int alder, long addr, int off, int len)

methodNames: public void update(byte[] b, int off, int len)

private static native int updateByteBuffer0(int alder, long addr, int off, int len)
